definition: rich/abundant/exuberant/to add for free/to throw in as bonus/to spare/to forgive/despite/although
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement

sentences.english: NASA followed Stevie’s progress with interest.
sentences.chinese: 国家航空总署饶有兴趣地追踪着史蒂夫此事的进展。

sentences.english: After the ruins it is very interesting to peep into the cave settlement.
sentences.chinese: 离开遗址之后，我们饶有兴趣地往洞穴里面看。
皮彻饶有兴趣地看着他们。

sentences.english: All the men eyed the beautiful girl with interest.
sentences.chinese: 所有男人都饶有兴趣地盯着看这位美丽的姑娘。

sentences.english: Tett said recently that her young daughters had watched her book's progress with interest.
sentences.chinese: 她年幼的女儿们饶有兴趣地看着她写完书。

sentences.english: Participating representatives visited the Ministry of Foreign Affairs with great interest in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午，与会代表们还饶有兴趣地参观了外交部。

sentences.english: However it's going to be interesting to see how long they can keep it up.
sentences.chinese: 然而他们能坚持多久，我们饶有兴趣的拭目以待。

definition: to be calm and unruffled in the midst of chaos or at a busy time (idiom)
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
decline to comment/not express an opinion/be noncommittal/hedge
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
